tag_list: data-mining, cloud-storage, saas, social-privacy, paas, entrepreneur, e-commerce
overview:
Ms. Yadav-Ranjan is Co- Founder, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Gray Cloud Technology since 2010 a Data / Media delivery platform company.

Ms. Yadav-Ranjan has twelve years as an entrepreneurial executive, coupled with over fifteen years of focused experience in data crawling and parsing in a cloud environment, E-commerce, banking, finance and construction puts her in a unique vantage point to provide insight into these fast-growing markets. Ms. Yadav-Ranjan has filed, and been issued, multiple key patents, author and a sought after speaker on innovation and technology.

Prior to founding Gray Cloud, Ms. Yadav-Ranjan was the Founder, Chairman & CEO of Navigator Technology a cloud based data mining company where she delivered a exit offer, and from 1999-2002 CEO of eCite.org an ecommerce payments company. Ms. Yadav-Ranjan has also held various leadership roles at DCI consulting group in Denver, Colorado.

Ms. Yadav-Ranjan has served on multiple for-profit & non-profit boards and currently serves as University of California Merced Board of Trustees, Chairwoman Membership committee & Executive Committee member.

As Co-Founder of the Award winning, University of California Merced Mobile App Challenge, she created initiatives that apply technology to create socio-economic impact and to create positive outcomes for students while providing valuable industry knowledge and experience. In 2012, Ms. Yadav-Ranjan founded the “Entrepreneur’s Vision” Speaker series.

Ms. Yadav-Ranjan was a participant of the Ecommerce and Technology trade mission to Nagasaki, Japan. Her keynote paper on the “Future of Ecommerce in shaping the new economy” was widely discussed at the University of Nagasaki and was used to build Nagasaki Prefecture’s policy on Ecommerce adoption. Ms. Yadav-Ranjan is listed in the Who’s Who in Ecommerce in 2001 and 2002.

milestones.description: Named "one of the 100 Most Influential Business women in the Bay Area" by Silicon Valley Business Journal
